thread.title: There's Rumor of a Press Boycott of the White House Correspondents’ Dinner
thread.title_full: There's Rumor of a Press Boycott of the White House Correspondents’ Dinner

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: There's Rumor of a Press Boycott of the White House Correspondents’ Dinner
text:
This year's White House Correspondent's Dinner is shaping up to be a controversial affair — mainly because of President Donald Trump's hostile treatment of the press. Now, according to the Washington Post , some in the media are pushing back, saying that as long as Trump and his administration continue to show a total lack of respect for the press, the press shouldn't show up for the event.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The dinner, which highlights the work of the journalists covering the White House and is headlined by the current Commander-in-Chief, has already had two high profile publications pull out. Both Vanity Fair and the New Yorker have said they won't be attending, and more are likely to follow.
While that might be a blow for the White House, it's a win for comedian Samantha Bee, of the excellent Full Frontal With Samantha Bee , who is planning her “ Not the White House Correspondents’ Dinner ," on the same night in Washington, D.C. The alternative event will provide an opportunity for comedians and journalists to properly roast Melania's husband, without the fear of tweet storm retaliation from Trump.
Whether or not Trump himself will come to the April 29th event remains to be seen. Those close to the situation say it depends entirely on who hosts it — if it's someone who's known to be soft on the President, like Jimmy Fallon, then he might show, but if it's a more hard-hitting comedian, he probably won't. A no show from Trump would be very unusual, as the last President who didn't attend the dinner was Ronald Reagan in 1981 — and that's because he'd just been shot.
Follow Laura on Twitter .
